headers: EXPERT GRADING RUBRIC — INCLUDED IN ONBOARDING PACKET

rows.EXPERT GRADING RUBRIC — INCLUDED IN ONBO: This is what the expert uses to assign grades. Specific enough that two experts would give similar grades on the same work.

rows.col_3: Could be published or implemented as-is. Original insights beyond what Claude + a generalist PM would produce. Expert learned something reading it. No significant gaps.
rows.col_4: Lock immediately. File V-tab with per-tab notes. Record on show.
rows.col_5: PM earns full sprint equity + recognition.

rows.col_3: Minor gaps or refinements needed but the structure, reasoning, and conclusions are sound. A competent operator could use this with light editing.
rows.col_4: Lock with noted minor improvements. PM can address in implementation phase.

rows.col_3: Meets the standard. No major errors. Covers the scope. Some areas could be deeper but nothing is wrong. This is the EXPECTED grade for well-specified P-tabs + Claude + competent PM.
rows.col_4: Lock. File V-tab. Note areas for future depth.

rows.col_3: Barely meets standard. Several areas feel thin. Would need meaningful revision before an operator could use it confidently. On the boundary.
rows.col_4: Expert's judgment: lock with caveats or return for revision. Must justify either way in writing.
rows.col_5: PM earns full sprint equity if locked. If returned, see C.

rows.col_3: Significant gaps, errors, or missing analysis. Not usable as-is. Requires substantial revision. Usually means the PM didn't engage deeply with Claude's output — just submitted the draft.
rows.col_4: Return to production. Expert writes specific remediation notes: "fix X, add Y, redo Z." PM gets one revision cycle.
rows.col_5: PM equity paused for this sprint. Earned on successful re-review.

rows.col_3: Fundamental problems. Wrong conclusions, missing core sections, no original contribution beyond Claude's raw output. Would mislead an operator who relied on it.
rows.col_4: Return to production with major remediation. Post-mortem required: why did this happen? P-tab underspecified? PM disengaged? Wrong domain fit?
rows.col_5: PM equity at risk. Forfeiture possible on second D.

rows.col_3: Not submitted in good faith. Placeholder content. Claude output pasted with no refinement. Or factually dangerous (would cause legal/financial/health harm if implemented).
rows.col_4: Reject entirely. PM exits the cluster. New PM assigned. This TUP starts over.
rows.col_5: PM equity forfeited for this sprint. No re-review.

rows.EXPERT GRADING RUBRIC — INCLUDED IN ONBO: Every C-tab gets a note. Not just the overall TUP — each individual tab.
Notes must be specific. "Looks good" is rejected. "Strong supplier analysis for sodium; missing backup supplier for magnesium citrate; price assumptions need sourcing verification" is accepted.
Expert must note at least one strength and one gap per tab. If they can't find a gap, the tab is either perfect (rare) or the expert didn't read carefully (common).
Estimated review time: 1-2 hours per TUP (3-5 C-tabs). If the expert finishes in 30 minutes, they didn't engage deeply enough.
Grade without per-tab notes is automatically rejected by the Librarian. Expert must resubmit.
